summary: Md Zainul Ali is a doctoral research scholar in the Department of Biotechnology & Bioinformatics, School of Life Sciences, University of Hyderabad, India. His research broadly focuses on the computational exploration of neurodegenerative disorders, with a specialization in Parkinson's disease. He applies machine learning, statistical modeling, and systems biology approaches to identify clinically relevant non-motor features and their molecular underpinnings.

experience.description: Conducting computational research on Parkinson's disease, applying machine learning and systems biology approaches to identify clinically relevant biomarkers.
achievements: Developed interactive computational tools for Parkinson's risk assessment
Oral presentation at MDS International Congress (Philadelphia, 2024)
Published review article in Neurochemistry International (2022)

experience.description: Analysis of Complex-1 associated genes in Parkinson's disease for risk assessment
achievements: Integrated Complex-I associated gene interactions into one platform.
Developed a predictive model for Parkinson’s disease risk.
Demonstrated compensatory effects among Parkinson’s risk genes.

projects.title: Identification of Early Biomarkers for Parkinson's Disease Using Machine Learning and WGCNA
projects.subtitle: Molecular Basis of Smell Loss in Parkinson's
projects.description: Applying ML and WGCNA on clinical and transcriptomic data to detect early biomarkers, with special focus on smell loss; improving patient-healthy control classification.
features: A subset of Non-motor symptom predicts Parkinson's disease
Smell loss is the strongest predictive symptom for PD
Integration with clinical data with transcriptomic data

projects.title: Early Diagnosis Tool Using Transfer Learning & Collaborative Filtering
projects.subtitle: Parkinson's Disease Risk Assessment Tool
projects.description: An interactive computational tool for assessing Parkinson's disease risk based on non-motor symptoms and molecular biomarkers, integrating machine learning models for early diagnosis.
features: Risk assessment based on non-motor symptoms

projects.title: Analysis of Complex-I Associated Genes in Parkinson's Disease
projects.subtitle: Interactive Data Exploration for Parkinson's Research
projects.description: An online predictor tool using HTML, CSS, JavaScript to assess gene-based risk in Parkinson's Disease.

conferences.description: Showcased research on network-based analysis of neurodegenerative disorders using multi-omics data integration.

conferences.title: European Conference on Computational Biology
conferences.description: Presented work on machine learning approaches for predicting disease progression in Parkinson's patients.

reviews.title: Oxidative phosphorylation mediated pathogenesis of Parkinson's disease and its implication via Akt signaling
reviews.summary: Comprehensive review examining the role of oxidative phosphorylation dysfunction in Parkinson's disease pathogenesis and its implications through Akt signaling pathways.

bookChapters.title: Early Diagnosis of Parkinson's Disease: Utility of Animal Models
bookChapters.summary: Chapter discussing the utility of animal models in early diagnosis of Parkinson's disease, exploring their role in understanding disease mechanisms and developing diagnostic strategies.
bookChapters.bookTitle: Parkinson's Disease - Animal Models, Current Therapies and Clinical Trials

abstracts.title: Integrating Non-Motor Symptoms and Gender Variability in Machine Learning for Early Parkinson's Disease Detection
abstracts.summary: Presentation of novel machine learning approaches integrating non-motor symptoms and gender variability for early detection of Parkinson's disease.
abstracts.conference: International Conference on Parkinson's Disease Research

abstracts.title: Gender-Specific Classification Models for Parkinson's Disease Using Non-Motor Symptoms and DNA Methylation Data
abstracts.summary: Analysis of gender-specific classification models utilizing non-motor symptoms and DNA methylation data for Parkinson's disease diagnosis.

seo.metaTitle: Zain - Doctoral Research Scholar in Computational Neuroscience
seo.metaDescription: Md Zainul Ali is a doctoral research scholar specializing in computational approaches to neurodegenerative disorders, with a focus on Parkinson's disease at University of Hyderabad.
